meanings.definition: A line on a graph representing equal time intervals.
meanings.sent1: The isochron on the graph shows the same time intervals.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use an isochron to mark equal time points on the chart.
meanings.sent3: The isochron on the graph decided to take a break and stay still for a while.
meanings.sent4: The isochron acted like a ruler, dividing the time axis into equal parts.
meanings.sent5: The bright red isochron stood out on the graph, making it easy to read.

meanings.definition: A method of dating rocks based on the principle that the daughter nuclide in a radioactive decay chain is in equilibrium with the parent nuclide.
meanings.sent1: Geologists rely on the isochron to determine rock ages accurately.
meanings.sent2: Using the isochron technique, scientists can date rocks with precision.
meanings.sent3: The isochron method joked that it was the best at finding rock love connections.
meanings.sent4: The isochron was like a time detective, solving the mystery of rock ages.
meanings.sent5: The isochron technique painted a clear picture of rock history for researchers.
